results.title: End of the line
results.brief_description: This film was shot in a small industrial village, in North West England, called Heap Bridge. The film examines this village, its main industry being papermaking, and its history that goes back to the Industrial Revolution over 150 years ago.

results.title: End of a summers day
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, George Pearson, Don Rennick and Robert Fortier
results.brief_description: A comment without words on the ancient theme of love and war: the man called to arms for his country; his sweetheart left behind to mourn; sorrow and separation visited upon the innocent. This is how it has always been, but implicit in the film are the protests of a new generation: Must it always be so? Is not love better than war? Cast includes: Michel Gauthier, Dennis Nadeau, Caroline Price, Paul Sullivan. (Award: New York)

results.title: End game in Paris
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Robert Verrall and Veronika Soul
results.brief_description: An adaptation of a segment of Ian Adam’s novel ‘End Game in Paris’, this film concerns a man’s search for his double. The man, a freelance photographer recently returned from Saigon, discovers that his life is being threatened. Filmmaker Veronika Soul experiments with sound and image to create a tense, enigmatic drama in which the audience is walked along a thin edge. Camera by Wolf Koenig. (Awards: Yorkton)

results.title: End Game
results.creator_credit: Rhys Graham, Emma Crimmings and Michael Fairlie
results.brief_description: Using the fragments, clock leaders and strips of films found at the beginning and end of hundreds of old 16mm films, this Public Imaging work explores the visual beauty of the film’s surface. Concealed among ACMI’s vast film collection, these pieces of film are a testament to the aging wonder of celluloid. The play of light and colour that can be found in the interweaving of these accidents and offcuts makes for a hypnotic experience.

results.title: Encyclopedia galactica. The outer solar system
results.brief_description: Computer graphics and recently released pictures of the cosmos show spectacular views of Jupiter and its many moons from the Voyager spacecraft, Saturn’s rings, moons and awesome weather conditions, the huge gas giants of Uranus and Neptune, comets, meteorites and asteroids.

results.title: Encyclopedia galactica. The inner solar system
results.brief_description: New computer graphics and recently released pictures of the cosmos show a journey through the nine planets of the solar sytem, the birth if the sun, the hole in the ozone layer over the South Pole, how the moon was born, and Mercury and Venus, the two hottest planets nearest the sun.

results.title: Encyclopedia galactica. Star trekking
results.brief_description: Dramatic computer graphics and recently released pictures provide a fascinating introduction to the night sky including how the positions of stars change over thousands of years and a guide to the stars and constellations through the yearly cycle.

results.title: Encyclopedia Galactica. Discovery
results.brief_description: The story of manned spaceflight from the Russian cosmonauts and Sputnik, to the first landing on the moon, rising the shuttle into the unknown, a new space station orbiting the earth and robot explorers. A look at machines preparing the way ahead through superb new pictures from the Hubble space telescope.

results.title: Encyclopedia Galactica. Astronomy and the stars
results.brief_description: The birth of the universe, black holes, quasars, photographing the sky, the best telescopes for the lay astronomer, how a planetarium works, major space centres, observatories and astronomical sites, the history of astronomy from the megalithic observatory of Stonehenge to today - in stunning photography and computer graphics.
results.description: The birth of the universe, black holes, quasars, photographing the sky, the best telescopes for the lay astronomer, how a planetarium works, major space centres, observatories and astronomical sites, the history of astronomy from the megalithic observatory of Stonehenge to today - in stunning photography and computer graphics.

results.title: Encyclopaedia galactica
results.creator_credit: KCET (Television station : Los Angeles, Calif.), Carl Sagan Productions, BBC, Polytel, Gregory Andorfer and Adrian Malone
results.brief_description:
Episode number 12 of Series “Cosmos: a personal voyage”.
In this episode Carl Sagan tackles the question of the possibilities of life on other planets. In spite of the lack of compelling credible evidence that alien visitors have visited our planet, Sagan demonstrates the probability of life existing elsewhere in the universe, and some of the possible forms this life might take. He also discusses the possibility of interstellar communication and how this might be interpreted, using the example of the deciphering of Egyptian hieroglyphics by Jean Francois Champollion, posing the notion that the laws of science are a common language, a kind of Rosetta Stone.
